text: the police said we're going to bring him
down you got about five minutes to get
in position
I picked my spot I pre focused my camera
they're stepping into the opening all of
a sudden somebody comes out to my right
quickly two steps real fast
Oswald and the police stepped out ruby
went that way fired and I punched the
shutter
he's almost 2 o'clock by the time I got
back to the paper and they called me
over and they said do you have anything
as good as this then it was Jack beers
picture which was already on the wire
jack always liked to get up high he was
standing on this little concrete wall
behind us and I really think that's why
he fired his camera when he did because
he saw it happening first so I went in
ran my film
chief photographers right outside the
door and I remember you letting out some
sort of a yell and that's when we
realized we'd be to our competition
we had pre arranged for me to unload my
cameras and toss the film out to a
reporter who was waiting as we turned
the corner from Maine on to Houston we
heard the first shot the physical
something has happened in the motorcade
route something I repeat has happened in
the motorcade route after the first shot
there were two more closer together I
looked right up there at the Book
Depository I saw two men looking up
above them and there was a rifle resting
on the ledge and he drew it in I just
thought I missed the picture I missed
the picture there and it was pretty
depressing even if I had had film in the
camera I don't think I could have swung
it up focused and shot fast enough
well after the assassination of course I
continued on as a news photographer I
had always had dreams I guess you'd say
working for a big magazine and covering
world events but at the time of the
assassination I was married with one
child and one on the way I was happy
working at the Times Herald and then
eventually I went to the Denver Post
shooting the Oswald picture and then
winning the field search certainly put
pressure on me to always strive to do
the best I can or could on any
assignment no matter how small it was
you know
